images.title: Protect your neck
images.caption: Protect your neck
images.desc: Happy Halloween boos and ghouls! We hope our vampire wasn’t too scary on this day designed for spooky delights. The fortress in our image is Corvin Castle in Romania - not far from Transylvania, a real historical region in Romania. In Bram Stoker’s novel ‘Dracula’ the ghoulish count lives in a remote Transylvanian castle, cementing the place in popular imagination as the home of Count Dracula. Be careful out there tonight should you go haunting for treats, and keep reminding yourself: There’s no such thing as vampires…
